en.bdb: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
Name of the true Guru is the truth, knowable only becoming gurmukh, the Guru orientated.
The holy congregation is the only place where sabad-brahm,

verse.gurmukhi: drgh scu inAwau jl duDu CwxIAY[
verse.unicode: ਦਰਗਹ ਸਚੁ ਨਿਆਉ ਜਲ ਦੁਧੁ ਛਾਣੀਐ।

en.bdb: The true justice is done and water is sifted from milk.

transliteration.english: dharageh sach niaau jal dhudh chhaaneeaai|
transliteration.hindi: दरगह सचु निआउ जल दुधु छाणीऐ।
transliteration.en: dharageh sach niaau jal dhudh chhaaneeaai|
transliteration.hi: दरगह सचु निआउ जल दुधु छाणीऐ।
transliteration.ipa: d̪ərəGəh sət͡ʃ nɪəɑo d͡ʒəl d̪ʊt̪ ɕɑɳiæ.
transliteration.ur: درگه سچ نآا جل دُدھ چھاݨیِاَے۔

en.bdb: Surrender before the Guru is the safest shelter, where through service (the merit) is earned.

verse.gurmukhi: sbd suriq suix gwau AMdir AwxIAY[
verse.unicode: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਗਾਉ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਆਣੀਐ।

en.bdb: Here, with full attention the Word is listened to, sung and embedded in the heart.

transliteration.english: sabadh surat sun gaau a(n)dhar aaneeaai|
transliteration.hindi: सबद सुरति सुणि गाउ अंदरि आणीऐ।
transliteration.en: sabadh surat sun gaau a(n)dhar aaneeaai|
transliteration.hi: सबद सुरति सुणि गाउ अंदरि आणीऐ।
transliteration.ipa: səbəd̪ sʊrət̪ sʊɳ Gɑo əŋd̪ər əɑɳiæ.
transliteration.ur: سبد سُرت سُݨ گاا اںدر آݨیِاَے۔

en.bdb: I am sacrifice unto such a Guru who bestows honour to the humble and the lowly.
Congregation of the Sikhs of the Guru
In the congregation of the Sikhs of the Guru, the people of all the varnas assemble.

verse.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrgu ivKu AMqu n pwvxw[
verse.unicode: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗੁ ਵਿਖੁ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਪਾਵਣਾ।

en.bdb: The way of the gurmukhs is difficult and its mystery cannot be understood.

transliteration.english: gurmukh maarag vikh a(n)t na paavanaa|
transliteration.hindi: गुरमुखि मारगु विखु अंतु न पावणा।
transliteration.en: gurmukh maarag vikh a(n)t na paavanaa|
transliteration.hi: गुरमुखि मारगु विखु अंतु न पावणा।
transliteration.ipa: Gʊrəmʊkʰ mɑrəG ʋɪkʰ əŋt̪ nə pɑʋəɳɑ.
transliteration.ur: گُرمکھ مارگ وکھ اںت ن پاوݨا۔

verse.gurmukhi: quil n AMimRq ieK kIrqnu gwvxw[
verse.unicode: ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਇਖ ਕੀਰਤਨੁ ਗਾਵਣਾ।

en.bdb: Even the sweet juice of sugarcane cannot be compared with the delight of kirtan, the melodious recitation of hymns.

transliteration.english: tul na a(n)mirat ikh keeratan gaavanaa|
transliteration.hindi: तुलि न अंमृत इख कीरतनु गावणा।
transliteration.en: tul na a(n)mirat ikh keeratan gaavanaa|
transliteration.hi: तुलि न अंमृत इख कीरतनु गावणा।
transliteration.ipa: t̪ʊl nə əŋmɪɹət̪ eɪkʰ kirət̪ən Gɑʋəɳɑ.
transliteration.ur: تُل ن اںمرت اکھ کیِرتن گاوݨا۔

en.bdb: Here, the seeker gets all the four ideals of life i.e., dharma, arth, kam and moks.
Those who have cultivated the Word, have merged in the Lord and have liberated themselves from all the accounts.

verse.gurmukhi: suJin BUq BivK n Awpu jxwvxw ]2]
verse.unicode: ਸੁਝਨਿ ਭੂਤ ਭਵਿਖ ਨ ਆਪੁ ਜਣਾਵਣਾ ॥੨॥

en.bdb: They see through all the ages and yet do not put themselves above others.

transliteration.english: sujhan bhoot bhavikh na aap janaavanaa ||2||
transliteration.hindi: सुझनि भूत भविख न आपु जणावणा ॥२॥
transliteration.en: sujhan bhoot bhavikh na aap janaavanaa ||2||
transliteration.hi: सुझनि भूत भविख न आपु जणावणा ॥२॥
transliteration.ipa: sʊɖ͡ʐən ɓut̪ ɓəʋɪkʰ nə əɑp d͡ʒəɳɑʋəɳɑ.2.
transliteration.ur: سُجھن بھُوت بھوکھ ن آپ جݨاوݨا ۔۔۲۔۔

en.bdb: Sight of unapproachable
I bow before the eternal Lord who by his own grace shows his invisible form (in all the creatures).
He gracefully makes the unstruck melody enter into the unchiselled mind and refines it.
He, in the company of the saints, makes one drink the nectar, which otherwise is not easy to digest.
Those who have received the teachings of the perfect, remain steadfast on truth.

verse.gurmukhi: gurmuiK BUpiq vyis n ivAwpY mwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਭੂਪਤਿ ਵੇਸਿ ਨ ਵਿਆਪੈ ਮਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: In fact, the gurmukhs are the kings but they remain away from maya.

transliteration.english: gurmukh bhoopat ves na viaapai maiaa|
transliteration.hindi: गुरमुखि भूपति वेसि न विआपै माइआ।
transliteration.en: gurmukh bhoopat ves na viaapai maiaa|
transliteration.hi: गुरमुखि भूपति वेसि न विआपै माइआ।
transliteration.ipa: Gʊrəmʊkʰ ɓupət̪ ʋes nə ʋɪəɑpæ mɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: گُرمکھ بھُوپت وےس ن وآپَے ماایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: bRhmy ibsn mhyS n drsnu pwieAw ]3]
verse.unicode: ਬ੍ਰਹਮੇ ਬਿਸਨ ਮਹੇਸ਼ ਨ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਪਾਇਆ ॥੩॥

en.bdb: Brahma, Visnu and Mahesa cannot have the sight of the Lord (but the gurmukhs have the same)

transliteration.english: brahame bisan mahesh na dharasan paiaa ||3||
transliteration.hindi: ब्रहमे बिसन महेश न दरसनु पाइआ ॥३॥
transliteration.en: brahame bisan mahesh na dharasan paiaa ||3||
transliteration.hi: ब्रहमे बिसन महेश न दरसनु पाइआ ॥३॥
transliteration.ipa: bɹəhəme bɪsən məheʃ nə d̪ərəsən pɑɪɑ.3.
transliteration.ur: برهمے بسن مهےش ن درسن پاایا ۔۔۳۔۔

en.bdb: Brahma,Visnu,Mahesa
Visnu incarnated ten times and established his names.

verse.gurmukhi: kir kir Asur sMGwr vwdu vDwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਸੁਰ ਸੰਘਾਰ ਵਾਦੁ ਵਧਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: Destroying the demons he increased the conflicts.

transliteration.english: kar kar asur sa(n)ghaar vaadh vadhaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: करि करि असुर संघार वादु वधाइआ।
transliteration.en: kar kar asur sa(n)ghaar vaadh vadhaiaa|
transliteration.hi: करि करि असुर संघार वादु वधाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: kər kər əsʊr səŋGʰɑr ʋɑd̪ ʋət̪ɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: کر کرِ اسر سںگھار واد ودھاایا۔

en.bdb: Brahma thoughtfully recited the four Vedas;
But created the universe out of his ego.
Siva being engrossed in tamas always remained vexed and angry.
Only gurmukhs, the Guru orientated, forswearing their ego reach the door of liberation.
Sanak and Sukdev et al.
Even being an ascetic, Narad merely talked (of here and there).
Being a backbiter, he popularised himself only as a tell-tale.
Sanak et al. got angry when they having gone to Visnu were not allowed entry by the doorkeepers.
They forced Visnu to undergo ten incarnations and thus the peaceful life of Visnu got tormented.

verse.gurmukhi: ijin suku jixAw mwie duKu shwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਜਿਨਿ ਸੁਕੁ ਜਣਿਆ ਮਾਇ ਦੁਖੁ ਸਹਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: The mother who gave birth to Sukdev was caused to suffer by him by remaining undelivered by the mother for twelve years.

transliteration.english: jin suk janiaa mai dhukh sahaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: जिनि सुकु जणिआ माइ दुखु सहाइआ।
transliteration.en: jin suk janiaa mai dhukh sahaiaa|
transliteration.hi: जिनि सुकु जणिआ माइ दुखु सहाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: d͡ʒɪn sʊk d͡ʒəɳɪəɑ mɑeɪ d̪ʊkʰ səhɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: جٍن سُک جݨآ ماا دُکھ سهاایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl Kwie Ajru jrwieAw ]5]
verse.unicode: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਖਾਇ ਅਜਰੁ ਜਰਾਇਆ ॥੫॥

en.bdb: Only gurmukhs tasting the fruit of supreme joy have endured the unendurable (name of the Lord).

transliteration.english: gurmukh sukh fal khai ajar jaraiaa ||5||
transliteration.hindi: गुरमुखि सुख फल खाइ अजरु जराइआ ॥५॥
transliteration.en: gurmukh sukh fal khai ajar jaraiaa ||5||
transliteration.hi: गुरमुखि सुख फल खाइ अजरु जराइआ ॥५॥
transliteration.ipa: Gʊrəmʊkʰ sʊkʰ fəl kʰɑeɪ əd͡ʒər d͡ʒərɑɪɑ.5.
transliteration.ur: گُرمکھ سُکھ پھل کھاا اجر جراایا ۔۔۵۔۔

en.bdb: The Earth

verse.gurmukhi: DrqI nIvIN hoie crx icqu lwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਧਰਤੀ ਨੀਵੀਂ ਹੋਇ ਚਰਣ ਚਿਤੁ ਲਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: The earth becoming lowly concentrated on the feet (of Lord).

transliteration.english: dharatee neevee(n) hoi charan chit laiaa|
transliteration.hindi: धरती नीवीं होइ चरण चितु लाइआ।
transliteration.en: dharatee neevee(n) hoi charan chit laiaa|
transliteration.hi: धरती नीवीं होइ चरण चितु लाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: t̪ərət̪i niʋiⁿ hɔeɪ t͡ʃərəɳ t͡ʃɪt̪ lɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: دھرتیِ نیِویِں هوا چرݨ چت لاایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: crx kvl rsu Boie Awpu gvwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਰਸੁ ਭੋਇ ਆਪੁ ਗਵਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: Being one with the joy of the lotus feet, it divested itself of the ego.

transliteration.english: charan kaval ras bhoi aap gavaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: चरण कवल रसु भोइ आपु गवाइआ।
transliteration.en: charan kaval ras bhoi aap gavaiaa|
transliteration.hi: चरण कवल रसु भोइ आपु गवाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: t͡ʃərəɳ kəʋəl rəs ɓɔeɪ əɑp Gəʋɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: چرݨ کول رس بھوا آپ گواایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: crx ryxu iqhu loie ieC ieCwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਚਰਣ ਰੇਣੁ ਤਿਹੁ ਲੋਇ ਇਛ ਇਛਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: It is that dust of the feet, which is desired by the three worlds.

transliteration.english: charan ren tih loi ichh ichhaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: चरण रेणु तिहु लोइ इछ इछाइआ।
transliteration.en: charan ren tih loi ichh ichhaiaa|
transliteration.hi: चरण रेणु तिहु लोइ इछ इछाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: t͡ʃərəɳ reɳ t̪ɪh lɔeɪ eɪɕ eɪɕɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: چرݨ رےݨ تهُ لوا اچھ اچھاایا۔

en.bdb: Fortitude and dutifulness added to it, the contentment is the basis of all.
It, considering the way of life of every creature, offers livelihood to all.
In accordance to the divine will, it behaves like a gurmukh does.
Water

verse.gurmukhi: pwxI DrqI ivic Driq ivic pwxIAY[
verse.unicode: ਪਾਣੀ ਧਰਤੀ ਵਿਚਿ ਧਰਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਾਣੀਐ।

en.bdb: The water is in the earth and the earth in the water.

transliteration.english: paanee dharatee vich dharat vich paaneeaai|
transliteration.hindi: पाणी धरती विचि धरति विचि पाणीऐ।
transliteration.en: paanee dharatee vich dharat vich paaneeaai|
transliteration.hi: पाणी धरती विचि धरति विचि पाणीऐ।
transliteration.ipa: pɑɳi t̪ərət̪i ʋɪt͡ʃ t̪ərət̪ ʋɪt͡ʃ pɑɳiæ.
transliteration.ur: پاݨیِ دھرتیِ وچ دھرت وچِ پاݨیِاَے۔

verse.gurmukhi: nIchu nIc n ihc inrml jwxIAY[
verse.unicode: ਨੀਚਹੁ ਨੀਚ ਨ ਹਿਚ ਨਿਰਮਲ ਜਾਣੀਐ।

en.bdb: Water has no hesitation in going low and lower; it is rather considered more pure.

transliteration.english: neechahu neech na hich niramal jaaneeaai|
transliteration.hindi: नीचहु नीच न हिच निरमल जाणीऐ।
transliteration.en: neechahu neech na hich niramal jaaneeaai|
transliteration.hi: नीचहु नीच न हिच निरमल जाणीऐ।
transliteration.ipa: nit͡ʃəh nit͡ʃ nə hɪt͡ʃ nɪrəməl d͡ʒɑɳiæ.
transliteration.ur: نیِچهُ نیِچ ن هچ نرمل جاݨیِاَے۔

en.bdb: To flow down, water bears the concussion of the gravitational force but still likes to go lower.

verse.gurmukhi: mn mylI Gul imc sB rMg mwxIAY[
verse.unicode: ਮਨ ਮੇਲੀ ਘੁਲ ਮਿਚ ਸਭ ਰੰਗ ਮਾਣੀਐ।

en.bdb: It absorbs in everybody and enjoys with one and all.

transliteration.english: man melee ghul mich sabh ra(n)g maaneeaai|
transliteration.hindi: मन मेली घुल मिच सभ रंग माणीऐ।
transliteration.en: man melee ghul mich sabh ra(n)g maaneeaai|
transliteration.hi: मन मेली घुल मिच सभ रंग माणीऐ।
transliteration.ipa: mən meli Gʰʊl mɪt͡ʃ səɓ rəŋG mɑɳiæ.
transliteration.ur: من مےلیِ گھُل مچ سبھ رںگ ماݨیِاَے۔

en.bdb: Meeting once it does not go apart and hence it is acceptable in the court of the Lord.
The devoted persons (bhagats) are identified through their service (to the mankind)
Trees
The tree on the earth has their heads down towards the bottom.
They endure suffering themselves but pour happiness on the world.

verse.gurmukhi: Pl dy lwhin BuK vt vgwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਫਲ ਦੇ ਲਾਹਨਿ ਭੁਖ ਵਟ ਵਗਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: Even on being stoned, they offer fruits and quench our hunger.

transliteration.english: fal dhe laahan bhukh vaT vagaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: फल दे लाहनि भुख वट वगाइआ।
transliteration.en: fal dhe laahan bhukh vaT vagaiaa|
transliteration.hi: फल दे लाहनि भुख वट वगाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: fəl d̪e lɑhən ɓʊkʰ ʋəʈ ʋəGɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: پھل دے لاهن بھُکھ وٹ وگااآ۔

verse.gurmukhi: Cwv GxI bih suK mnu prcwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਛਾਵ ਘਣੀ ਬਹਿ ਸੁਖ ਮਨੁ ਪਰਚਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: Their shadow is so thick that the mind (and body) enjoys peace.

transliteration.english: chhaav ghanee beh sukh man parachaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: छाव घणी बहि सुख मनु परचाइआ।
transliteration.en: chhaav ghanee beh sukh man parachaiaa|
transliteration.hi: छाव घणी बहि सुख मनु परचाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: ɕɑʋ Gʰəɳi bəh sʊkʰ mən pərət͡ʃɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: چھاو گھݨیِ بهِ سُکھ من پرچاایا۔

en.bdb: If someone cuts them, they offer to be sawed.
Rare are the persons like tree who accept the will of Lord.
Other gifts of the trees
From tree are made houses and pillars.
A tree getting sawed helps to make boat.
Then adding iron (nails) to it, it gets people float on water.
In spite of the myriads of waves of river, it takes people across.
Likewise, the Sikhs of the Guru, in love and fear of the Lord, practise the Word.
They make people follow the one Lord and get them liberated from the bondages of transmigration.
Examples of sesame seed
Sesame gets crushed in the oil press and gives oil.
The oil burns in the lamp and the darkness is dispelled.
The soot of the lamp becomes ink and the same oil reaches the ink-pot with whose help is written the Word of the Guru.

verse.gurmukhi: suix isiK iliK ilKwie AlyKu suxwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਸੁਣਿ ਸਿਖਿ ਲਿਖਿ ਲਿਖਾਇ ਅਲੇਖੁ ਸੁਣਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: By listening to, writing, learning and getting written the words, the imperceptible Lord is eulogised.

transliteration.english: sun sikh likh likhai alekh sunaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: सुणि सिखि लिखि लिखाइ अलेखु सुणाइआ।
transliteration.en: sun sikh likh likhai alekh sunaiaa|
transliteration.hi: सुणि सिखि लिखि लिखाइ अलेखु सुणाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: sʊɳ sɪkʰ lɪkʰ lɪkʰɑeɪ əlekʰ sʊɳɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: سُݨ سکھ لکھِ لکھاا الےکھ سُݨاایا۔

en.bdb: The gurmukhs, losing their sense of ego, practise the Word.

verse.gurmukhi: igAwn AMjn ilv lwie shij smwieAw ]10]
verse.unicode: ਗਿਆਨ ਅੰਜਨ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਇ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਇਆ ॥੧੦॥

en.bdb: And using the collyrium of knowledge and concentration immerses in equanimity.

transliteration.english: giaan a(n)jan liv lai sahaj samaiaa ||10||
transliteration.hindi: गिआन अंजन लिव लाइ सहजि समाइआ ॥१०॥
transliteration.en: giaan a(n)jan liv lai sahaj samaiaa ||10||
transliteration.hi: गिआन अंजन लिव लाइ सहजि समाइआ ॥१०॥
transliteration.ipa: Gɪəɑn əŋd͡ʒən lɪʋ lɑeɪ səhəd͡ʒ səmɑɪɑ.1ə0.
transliteration.ur: گِآن اںجن لو لاا سهج سماایا ۔۔۱۰۔۔

verse.gurmukhi: pauVI 11 : mnmuK nwloN pSU au~qm hY
verse.unicode: ਪਉੜੀ ੧੧ : ਮਨਮੁਖ ਨਾਲੋਂ ਪਸ਼ੂ ਉੱਤਮ ਹੈ

en.bdb: Animal is better than a Manmukh, the mind=oriented

transliteration.english: pauRee 11 : manmukh naalo(n) pashoo u'tam hai
transliteration.hindi: पउड़ी ११ : मनमुख नालों पशू उत्तम है
transliteration.en: pauRee 11 : manmukh naalo(n) pashoo u'tam hai
transliteration.hi: पउड़ी ११ : मनमुख नालों पशू उत्तम है
transliteration.ipa: poʊɽi 1ə1 : mənəmʊkʰ nɑlɔⁿ pəʃu oʊt̪əm hæ
transliteration.ur: پاڑیِ ۱۱ : منمکھ نالوں پشُو اُ~تم هَے

verse.gurmukhi: duDu dyie KVu Kwie n Awpu gxwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਦੁਧੁ ਦੇਇ ਖੜੁ ਖਾਇ ਨ ਆਪੁ ਗਣਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: Standing into a pit they yield milk and do not pose to be counted, i.e. the animals do not have the ego.

transliteration.english: dhudh dhei khaR khai na aap ganaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: दुधु देइ खड़ु खाइ न आपु गणाइआ।
transliteration.en: dhudh dhei khaR khai na aap ganaiaa|
transliteration.hi: दुधु देइ खड़ु खाइ न आपु गणाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: d̪ʊt̪ d̪eeɪ kʰəɽ kʰɑeɪ nə əɑp Gəɳɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: دُدھ دےا کھڑ کھاا ن آپ گݨاایا۔

en.bdb: Milk is converted into curd and the butter comes thereof.
With their dung and urine, the earth is plastered to offer worship;
But while eating variety of goods man turns them into abominable faeces, useless for any purpose.
Those who have worshipped Lord in the holy congregation, their life is blessed and successful.

verse.gurmukhi: sPl jnmu jig Awie suK Pl pwieAw ]11]
verse.unicode: ਸਫਲ ਜਨਮੁ ਜਗਿ ਆਇ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਪਾਇਆ ॥੧੧॥

en.bdb: Only they get the fruit of life on earth.

transliteration.english: safal janam jag aai sukh fal paiaa ||11||
transliteration.hindi: सफल जनमु जगि आइ सुख फल पाइआ ॥११॥
transliteration.en: safal janam jag aai sukh fal paiaa ||11||
transliteration.hi: सफल जनमु जगि आइ सुख फल पाइआ ॥११॥
transliteration.ipa: səfəl d͡ʒənəm d͡ʒəG əɑeɪ sʊkʰ fəl pɑɪɑ.1ə1.
transliteration.ur: سپھل جنم جگ آا سُکھ پھل پاایا ۔۔۱۱۔۔

verse.gurmukhi: pauVI 12 : gurmuK kpwh vWg kSt shwrdy hn
verse.unicode: ਪਉੜੀ ੧੨ : ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਕਪਾਹ ਵਾਂਗ ਕਸ਼ਟ ਸਹਾਰਦੇ ਹਨ

en.bdb: Gurmukhs tolerate sufferings like cotton

transliteration.english: pauRee 12 : gurmukh kapaeh vaa(n)g kashaT sahaaradhe han
transliteration.hindi: पउड़ी १२ : गुरमुख कपाह वाँग कशट सहारदे हन
transliteration.en: pauRee 12 : gurmukh kapaeh vaa(n)g kashaT sahaaradhe han
transliteration.hi: पउड़ी १२ : गुरमुख कपाह वाँग कशट सहारदे हन
transliteration.ipa: poʊɽi 1ə2 : Gʊrəmʊkʰ kəpɑh ʋɑⁿəG kəʃəʈ səhɑrəd̪e hən
transliteration.ur: پاڑیِ ۱۲ : گُرمکھ کپاه واںگ کشٹ سهاردے هن

en.bdb: Accepting the will of the Lord, cotton suffers a lot.
Having been ginned through the roller, it is carded.
Having carded it, its yarn is spun.
Then the weaver with the help of his reed, eaves it into cloth.
The washerman puts that cloth into his boiling cauldron and then washes it on a stream.
Putting on the same clothes, the rich and the kings adorn the assemblies.

verse.gurmukhi: pauVI 13 : gurmuK mjIT qy kmwd vWg syvw qoN mUMh nhIN moVdy
verse.unicode: ਪਉੜੀ ੧੩ : ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਮਜੀਠ ਤੇ ਕਮਾਦ ਵਾਂਗ ਸੇਵਾ ਤੋਂ ਮੂੰਹ ਨਹੀਂ ਮੋੜਦੇ

en.bdb: Gurmukhs keep busy in service

transliteration.english: pauRee 13 : gurmukh majeeTh te kamaadh vaa(n)g sevaa to(n) moo(n)h nahee(n) moRadhe
transliteration.hindi: पउड़ी १३ : गुरमुख मजीठ ते कमाद वाँग सेवा तों मूँह नहीं मोड़दे
transliteration.en: pauRee 13 : gurmukh majeeTh te kamaadh vaa(n)g sevaa to(n) moo(n)h nahee(n) moRadhe
transliteration.hi: पउड़ी १३ : गुरमुख मजीठ ते कमाद वाँग सेवा तों मूँह नहीं मोड़दे
transliteration.ipa: poʊɽi 1ə3 : Gʊrəmʊkʰ məd͡ʒiʈʰ t̪e kəmɑd̪ ʋɑⁿəG seʋɑ t̪ɔⁿ muŋh nəhiⁿ mɔɽəd̪e
transliteration.ur: پاڑیِ ۱۳ : گُرمکھ مجیِٹھ تے کماد واںگ سےوا توں مُوںه نهیِں موڑدے

en.bdb: Madder (Rubia munjista) knowing very well gets itself grinded.

verse.gurmukhi: kdy n CfY sMgu bxq bxwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਕਦੇ ਨ ਛਡੈ ਸੰਗੁ ਬਣਤ ਬਣਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: Its character is such that it never deserts the clothes.

transliteration.english: kadhe na chhaddai sa(n)g banat banaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: कदे न छडै संगु बणत बणाइआ।
transliteration.en: kadhe na chhaddai sa(n)g banat banaiaa|
transliteration.hi: कदे न छडै संगु बणत बणाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: kəd̪e nə ɕəɖæ səŋG bəɳət̪ bəɳɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: کدے ن چھڈَے سںگ بݨت بݨاایا۔

en.bdb: Likewise, the sugarcane also care freely gets itself crushed.

verse.gurmukhi: krY n mn rs BMgu AimE cuAwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਕਰੈ ਨ ਮਨ ਰਸ ਭੰਗੁ ਅਮਿਓ ਚੁਆਇਆ।

en.bdb: Without leaving away its sweetness offers the taste of nectar.

transliteration.english: karai na man ras bha(n)g amio chuaaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: करै न मन रस भंगु अमिओ चुआइआ।
transliteration.en: karai na man ras bha(n)g amio chuaaiaa|
transliteration.hi: करै न मन रस भंगु अमिओ चुआइआ।
transliteration.ipa: kəræ nə mən rəs ɓəŋG əmɪo t͡ʃʊəɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: کرَے ن من رس بھںگ اماو چُآایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: guVu skr KMf AcMgu Bog BugwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਗੁੜੁ ਸਕਰ ਖੰਡ ਅਚੰਗੁ ਭੋਗ ਭੁਗਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: It produces jaggery, sugar, treacle molasses many relishable items.

transliteration.english: guR sakar kha(n)dd acha(n)g bhog bhugaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: गुड़ु सकर खंड अचंगु भोग भुगाइआ।
transliteration.en: guR sakar kha(n)dd acha(n)g bhog bhugaiaa|
transliteration.hi: गुड़ु सकर खंड अचंगु भोग भुगाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: Gʊɽ səkər kʰəŋɖ ət͡ʃəŋG ɓɔG ɓʊGɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: گُڑ سکر کھںڈ اچںگ بھوگ بھُگاایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: swD n moVn AMgu jgu prcwieAw ]13]
verse.unicode: ਸਾਧ ਨ ਮੋੜਨ ਅੰਗੁ ਜਗੁ ਪਰਚਾਇਆ ॥੧੩॥

en.bdb: Similarly, the saints also do not abstain from the service of mankind, and give happiness to all.

transliteration.english: saadh na moRan a(n)g jag parachaiaa ||13||
transliteration.hindi: साध न मोड़न अंगु जगु परचाइआ ॥१३॥
transliteration.en: saadh na moRan a(n)g jag parachaiaa ||13||
transliteration.hi: साध न मोड़न अंगु जगु परचाइआ ॥१३॥
transliteration.ipa: sɑt̪ə̀ nə mɔɽən əŋG d͡ʒəG pərət͡ʃɑɪɑ.1ə3.
transliteration.ur: سادھ ن موڑن اںگ جگ پرچاایا ۔۔۱۳۔۔

verse.gurmukhi: pauVI 14 : lohy vWg Awpw Bwv gvw ky hI Awpw dyKIdw hY
verse.unicode: ਪਉੜੀ ੧੪ : ਲੋਹੇ ਵਾਂਗ ਆਪਾ ਭਾਵ ਗਵਾ ਕੇ ਹੀ ਆਪਾ ਦੇਖੀਦਾ ਹੈ

en.bdb: By deleting of ego, like iron, one sees the self

transliteration.english: pauRee 14 : lohe vaa(n)g aapaa bhaav gavaa ke hee aapaa dhekheedhaa hai
transliteration.hindi: पउड़ी १४ : लोहे वाँग आपा भाव गवा के ही आपा देखीदा है
transliteration.en: pauRee 14 : lohe vaa(n)g aapaa bhaav gavaa ke hee aapaa dhekheedhaa hai
transliteration.hi: पउड़ी १४ : लोहे वाँग आपा भाव गवा के ही आपा देखीदा है
transliteration.ipa: poʊɽi 1ə4 : lɔhe ʋɑⁿəG əɑpɑ ɓɑʋ Gəʋɑ ke hi əɑpɑ d̪ekʰid̪ɑ hæ
transliteration.ur: پاڑیِ ۱۴ : لوهے واںگ آپا بھاو گوا کے هیِ آپا دےکھیِدا هَے

en.bdb: Putting iron into the furnance the iron is heated.
Then it is put on the anvil where it bears the strokes of hammer.
Making it clear like glass, its value is set.
Grinding against whet stones its parts are pruned i.e. many articles are made out of it.
Now keeping it (or those articles) in the saw-dust etc. it is left for getting clean.
Similarly the gurmukhs by losing their ego come face to face with their own basic nature.

verse.gurmukhi: pauVI 15 : rbwb vWg du`K shwr ky gurmuK sihj pd ivc smwauNdy hn
verse.unicode: ਪਉੜੀ ੧੫ : ਰਬਾਬ ਵਾਂਗ ਦੁੱਖ ਸਹਾਰ ਕੇ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸਹਿਜ ਪਦ ਵਿਚ ਸਮਾਉਂਦੇ ਹਨ

en.bdb: Example of rebeck

transliteration.english: pauRee 15 : rabaab vaa(n)g dhu'kh sahaar ke gurmukh sahij padh vich samaau(n)dhe han
transliteration.hindi: पउड़ी १५ : रबाब वाँग दुक्ख सहार के गुरमुख सहिज पद विच समाउंदे हन
transliteration.en: pauRee 15 : rabaab vaa(n)g dhu'kh sahaar ke gurmukh sahij padh vich samaau(n)dhe han
transliteration.hi: पउड़ी १५ : रबाब वाँग दुक्ख सहार के गुरमुख सहिज पद विच समाउंदे हन
transliteration.ipa: poʊɽi 1ə5 : rəbɑb ʋɑⁿəG d̪ʊkʰ səhɑr ke Gʊrəmʊkʰ səhɪd͡ʒ pəd̪ ʋɪt͡ʃ səmɑoʊⁿd̪e hən
transliteration.ur: پاڑیِ ۱۵ : رباب واںگ دُّکھ سهار کے گُرمکھ سهِج پد وچ سمااںدے هن

en.bdb: A handsome tree got cut itself and got manufactured into a rebeck.
A young goat underwent the mortification of getting killed itself; it distributed its meat among the meat-eaters.
Its intestines were made into gut and the skin was mounted (on drum) and stitched.
Now it is brought in the holy congregation where melody is produced on this instrument.
It creates the melody of Raag as the Shabad is heard.
Any one who worships true Guru, the God, gets absorbed into the equanimity.
Sandal tree

verse.gurmukhi: cMnxu ruKu aupwie vx KMif riKAw[
verse.unicode: ਚੰਨਣੁ ਰੁਖੁ ਉਪਾਇ ਵਣ ਖੰਡਿ ਰਖਿਆ।

en.bdb: God created the sandal tree and kept it in the forest.

transliteration.english: cha(n)nan rukh upai van kha(n)dd rakhiaa|
transliteration.hindi: चंनणु रुखु उपाइ वण खंडि रखिआ।
transliteration.en: cha(n)nan rukh upai van kha(n)dd rakhiaa|
transliteration.hi: चंनणु रुखु उपाइ वण खंडि रखिआ।
transliteration.ipa: t͡ʃəŋnəɳ rʊkʰ oʊpɑeɪ ʋəɳ kʰəŋɖ rəkʰɪəɑ.
transliteration.ur: چنّݨ رُکھ اُپاا وݨ کھںڈ رکھآ۔

verse.gurmukhi: pvxu gvxu kir jwie AlKu n liKAw[
verse.unicode: ਪਵਣੁ ਗਵਣੁ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਇ ਅਲਖੁ ਨ ਲਖਿਆ।

en.bdb: The breeze moves around the sandal but does not understand the imperceptible (nature of the tree).

transliteration.english: pavan gavan kar jai alakh na lakhiaa|
transliteration.hindi: पवणु गवणु करि जाइ अलखु न लखिआ।
transliteration.en: pavan gavan kar jai alakh na lakhiaa|
transliteration.hi: पवणु गवणु करि जाइ अलखु न लखिआ।
transliteration.ipa: pəʋəɳ Gəʋəɳ kər d͡ʒɑeɪ ələkʰ nə ləkʰɪəɑ.
transliteration.ur: پوݨ گوݨ کر جاا الکھ ن لکھِآ۔

en.bdb: The truth about the sandal comes to the forefront when it perfumes everyone with its fragrance.
The gurmukh goes beyond all the caste and the distinctions of eating taboos.

verse.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq BY Bwie Aipau pI ciKAw[
verse.unicode: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਭੈ ਭਾਇ ਅਪਿਉ ਪੀ ਚਖਿਆ।

en.bdb: He drinks the nectar of fear and love of the Lord in the holy congregation.

transliteration.english: saadhasa(n)gat bhai bhai apiau pee chakhiaa|
transliteration.hindi: साधसंगति भै भाइ अपिउ पी चखिआ।
transliteration.en: saadhasa(n)gat bhai bhai apiau pee chakhiaa|
transliteration.hi: साधसंगति भै भाइ अपिउ पी चखिआ।
transliteration.ipa: sɑt̪əsəŋGət̪ ɓæ ɓɑeɪ əpɪo pi t͡ʃəkʰɪəɑ.
transliteration.ur: سادھسںگت بھَے بھاا اپا پیِ چکھِآ۔

en.bdb: The Gurmukh comes face to face with his own intrinsic nature (sahaj subhai).
Service of the Gursikh
Within the teaching of the Guru, the Sikhs of the Guru serve (others).
They give in charity the four riches (char padarathi) to the beggars.
They sing paeans of the invisible Lord who is beyond all accounts.

verse.gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq rs ieK Aimau cuAwvxI[
verse.unicode: ਭਾਇ ਭਗਤਿ ਰਸ ਇਖ ਅਮਿਉ ਚੁਆਵਣੀ।

en.bdb: They drink the juice of the sugarcane of loving devotion, and make others also enjoy the same.

transliteration.english: bhai bhagat ras ikh amiau chuaavanee|
transliteration.hindi: भाइ भगति रस इख अमिउ चुआवणी।
transliteration.en: bhai bhagat ras ikh amiau chuaavanee|
transliteration.hi: भाइ भगति रस इख अमिउ चुआवणी।
transliteration.ipa: ɓɑeɪ ɓəGət̪ rəs eɪkʰ əmɪo t͡ʃʊəɑʋəɳi.
transliteration.ur: بھاا بھگت رس اکھ اما چُآوݨیِ۔

verse.gurmukhi: quil n BUq BivK n kImiq pwvxI[
verse.unicode: ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਭੂਤ ਭਵਿਖ ਨ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਪਾਵਣੀ।

en.bdb: Nothing in the past as well as the future can be equal to their love.

transliteration.english: tul na bhoot bhavikh na keemat paavanee|
transliteration.hindi: तुलि न भूत भविख न कीमति पावणी।
transliteration.en: tul na bhoot bhavikh na keemat paavanee|
transliteration.hi: तुलि न भूत भविख न कीमति पावणी।
transliteration.ipa: t̪ʊl nə ɓut̪ ɓəʋɪkʰ nə kimət̪ pɑʋəɳi.
transliteration.ur: تُل ن بھُوت بھوکھ ن کیِمت پاوݨیِ۔

verse.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrg ivK lvY n lwvxI ]17]
verse.unicode: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗ ਵਿਖ ਲਵੈ ਨ ਲਾਵਣੀ ॥੧੭॥

en.bdb: None can vie with even the one step of the way of gurmukhs.

transliteration.english: gurmukh maarag vikh lavai na laavanee ||17||
transliteration.hindi: गुरमुखि मारग विख लवै न लावणी ॥१७॥
transliteration.en: gurmukh maarag vikh lavai na laavanee ||17||
transliteration.hi: गुरमुखि मारग विख लवै न लावणी ॥१७॥
transliteration.ipa: Gʊrəmʊkʰ mɑrəG ʋɪkʰ ləʋæ nə lɑʋəɳi.1ə7.
transliteration.ur: گُرمکھ مارگ وکھ لوَے ن لاوݨیِ ۔۔۱۷۔۔

verse.gurmukhi: pauVI 18 : guris`KW dI syvw dw Pl
verse.unicode: ਪਉੜੀ ੧੮ : ਗੁਰਸਿੱਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਸੇਵਾ ਦਾ ਫਲ

en.bdb: Fruits of the service of Gursikhs

transliteration.english: pauRee 18 : gursi'khaa(n) dhee sevaa dhaa fal
transliteration.hindi: पउड़ी १८ : गुरसिक्खाँ दी सेवा दा फल
transliteration.en: pauRee 18 : gursi'khaa(n) dhee sevaa dhaa fal
transliteration.hi: पउड़ी १८ : गुरसिक्खाँ दी सेवा दा फल
transliteration.ipa: poʊɽi 1ə8 : Gʊrəsɪkʰɑⁿ d̪i seʋɑ d̪ɑ fəl
transliteration.ur: پاڑیِ ۱۸ : گُرسّکھاں دیِ سےوا دا پھل

verse.gurmukhi: ieMdR purI lK rwj nIr BrwvxI[
verse.unicode: ਇੰਦ੍ਰ ਪੁਰੀ ਲਖ ਰਾਜ ਨੀਰ ਭਰਾਵਣੀ।

en.bdb: Fetching water for the holy congregation is equal to the kingdom of lacs of Indrapuris.

transliteration.english: ei(n)dhr puree lakh raaj neer bharaavanee|
transliteration.hindi: इंद्र पुरी लख राज नीर भरावणी।
transliteration.en: ei(n)dhr puree lakh raaj neer bharaavanee|
transliteration.hi: इंद्र पुरी लख राज नीर भरावणी।
transliteration.ipa: eɪŋd̪ɹ pʊri ləkʰ rɑd͡ʒ nir ɓərɑʋəɳi.

en.bdb: Grinding of corn (for the holy congregation) is more than the pleasure of myriads of heavens.

verse.gurmukhi: iriD isiD iniD lK swj cuil JukwvxI[
verse.unicode: ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਲਖ ਸਾਜ ਚੁਲਿ ਝੁਕਾਵਣੀ।

en.bdb: Arranging for and putting in woods into the hearth of langar (free kitchen) for the congregation is equal to the rddhis, siddhis and the nine treasures.

transliteration.english: ridh sidh nidh lakh saaj chul jhukaavanee|
transliteration.hindi: रिधि सिधि निधि लख साज चुलि झुकावणी।
transliteration.en: ridh sidh nidh lakh saaj chul jhukaavanee|
transliteration.hi: रिधि सिधि निधि लख साज चुलि झुकावणी।
transliteration.ipa: rɪt̪ə̀ sɪt̪ə̀ nɪt̪ə̀ ləkʰ sɑd͡ʒ t͡ʃʊl ɖ͡ʐʊkɑʋəɳi.
transliteration.ur: رِدھ سدھ ندھِ لکھ ساج چُل جھُکاوݨیِ۔

en.bdb: The holy persons are the caretakers of the poor and in their company the humility resides in the heart (of people).
Singing of hymns of the Guru is the personification of the unstruck melody.
Fruits of the service

verse.gurmukhi: hom jg lK Bog cxy cbwvxI[
verse.unicode: ਹੋਮ ਜਗ ਲਖ ਭੋਗ ਚਣੇ ਚਬਾਵਣੀ।

en.bdb: To feed a Sikh with parched gram is superior to hundreds of thousands of burnt offerings and feasts.

transliteration.english: hom jag lakh bhog chane chabaavanee|
transliteration.hindi: होम जग लख भोग चणे चबावणी।
transliteration.en: hom jag lakh bhog chane chabaavanee|
transliteration.hi: होम जग लख भोग चणे चबावणी।
transliteration.ipa: hɔm d͡ʒəG ləkʰ ɓɔG t͡ʃəɳe t͡ʃəbɑʋəɳi.
transliteration.ur: هوم جگ لکھ بھوگ چݨے چباوݨیِ۔

en.bdb: To cause his to be washed is superior to visits to assemblages at the places of pilgrimages.

verse.gurmukhi: igAwn iDAwn lK jog sbd suxwvxI[
verse.unicode: ਗਿਆਨ ਧਿਆਨ ਲਖ ਜੋਗ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਣਾਵਣੀ।

en.bdb: To repeat to a Sikh of the Gurus hymns is equal to a hundred thousands of other religious exercises.

transliteration.english: giaan dhiaan lakh jog sabadh sunaavanee|
transliteration.hindi: गिआन धिआन लख जोग सबद सुणावणी।
transliteration.en: giaan dhiaan lakh jog sabadh sunaavanee|
transliteration.hi: गिआन धिआन लख जोग सबद सुणावणी।
transliteration.ipa: Gɪəɑn t̪ɪəɑn ləkʰ d͡ʒɔG səbəd̪ sʊɳɑʋəɳi.
transliteration.ur: گِآن دھآن لکھ جوگ سبد سُݨاوݨیِ۔

verse.gurmukhi: rhY n shsw sog JwqI pwvxI[
verse.unicode: ਰਹੈ ਨ ਸਹਸਾ ਸੋਗ ਝਾਤੀ ਪਾਵਣੀ।

en.bdb: Even the glimpse of the Guru dispels all doubts and regrets.

transliteration.english: rahai na sahasaa sog jhaatee paavanee|
transliteration.hindi: रहै न सहसा सोग झाती पावणी।
transliteration.en: rahai na sahasaa sog jhaatee paavanee|
transliteration.hi: रहै न सहसा सोग झाती पावणी।
transliteration.ipa: rəhæ nə səhəsɑ sɔG ɖ͡ʐɑt̪i pɑʋəɳi.
transliteration.ur: رهَے ن سهسا سوگ جھاتیِ پاوݨیِ۔

verse.gurmukhi: Baujl ivic Arog n lhir frwvxI[
verse.unicode: ਭਉਜਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਰੋਗ ਨ ਲਹਰਿ ਡਰਾਵਣੀ।

en.bdb: Such a man remains unscathed in the terrible world ocean and does not fear its waves.

transliteration.english: bhaujal vich arog na lahar ddaraavanee|
transliteration.hindi: भउजल विचि अरोग न लहरि डरावणी।
transliteration.en: bhaujal vich arog na lahar ddaraavanee|
transliteration.hi: भउजल विचि अरोग न लहरि डरावणी।
transliteration.ipa: ɓoʊd͡ʒəl ʋɪt͡ʃ ərɔG nə ləhər ɖərɑʋəɳi.
transliteration.ur: بھاجل وچ اروگ ن لهرِ ڈراوݨیِ۔

en.bdb: He whom embraces the Gurus religion (Gurmati) has past beyond the bounds of joy or grief for gain or loss.
Infinite Fruits of service
As the seed puts in the earth gives fruit thousand times more.

verse.gurmukhi: gurisK muiK pvwie n lyK ilKwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਮੁਖਿ ਪਵਾਇ ਨ ਲੇਖ ਲਿਖਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: The food put in the mouth of a gurmukh multiplies infinitely and its count becomes impossible.

transliteration.english: gursikh mukh pavai na lekh likhaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: गुरसिख मुखि पवाइ न लेख लिखाइआ।
transliteration.en: gursikh mukh pavai na lekh likhaiaa|
transliteration.hi: गुरसिख मुखि पवाइ न लेख लिखाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: Gʊrəsɪkʰ mʊkʰ pəʋɑeɪ nə lekʰ lɪkʰɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: گُرسکھ مُکھ پواا ن لےکھ لکھاایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: DrqI dyie Plwie joeI Plu pwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਧਰਤੀ ਦੇਇ ਫਲਾਇ ਜੋਈ ਫਲੁ ਪਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: The earth gives the fruit of the seed sowed in it;

transliteration.english: dharatee dhei falai joiee fal paiaa|
transliteration.hindi: धरती देइ फलाइ जोई फलु पाइआ।
transliteration.en: dharatee dhei falai joiee fal paiaa|
transliteration.hi: धरती देइ फलाइ जोई फलु पाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: t̪ərət̪i d̪eeɪ fəlɑeɪ d͡ʒɔei fəl pɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: دھرتیِ دےا پھلاا جوای پھل پاایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: gurisK muiK smwie sB Pl lwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਮੁਖਿ ਸਮਾਇ ਸਭ ਫਲ ਲਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: But the seed it offered to Guru oriented ones gives all sorts of fruits.

transliteration.english: gursikh mukh samai sabh fal laiaa|
transliteration.hindi: गुरसिख मुखि समाइ सभ फल लाइआ।
transliteration.en: gursikh mukh samai sabh fal laiaa|
transliteration.hi: गुरसिख मुखि समाइ सभ फल लाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: Gʊrəsɪkʰ mʊkʰ səmɑeɪ səɓ fəl lɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: گُرسکھ مُکھ سماا سبھ پھل لاایا۔

verse.gurmukhi: bIjy bwJu n Kwie n Driq jmwieAw[
verse.unicode: ਬੀਜੇ ਬਾਝੁ ਨ ਖਾਇ ਨ ਧਰਤਿ ਜਮਾਇਆ।

en.bdb: Without sowing, neither anyone could eat anything nor the earth can produce anything;

transliteration.english: beeje baajh na khai na dharat jamaiaa|
transliteration.hindi: बीजे बाझु न खाइ न धरति जमाइआ।
transliteration.en: beeje baajh na khai na dharat jamaiaa|
transliteration.hi: बीजे बाझु न खाइ न धरति जमाइआ।
transliteration.ipa: bid͡ʒe bɑɖ͡ʐ nə kʰɑeɪ nə t̪ərət̪ d͡ʒəmɑɪɑ.
transliteration.ur: بیِجے باجھ ن کھاا ن دھرت جماایا۔

en.bdb: Having the desire of serve the Gurmukh, fulfils all desires.
